Question
========

Of 80 patients with cancer in the head and neck area, a depression score was determined using the CES-D score list, a score for depression was determined. This score was then assigned to one of three classes. Also, the gender of the patient was noted. The results are shown in the cross tabulation below shown.

  ------------ ------------- ----------------- ------------- Frequency CES-D \< 10 10 ≤ CES-D ≤ 16 CES-D \> 16 male 5 15 10 female 6 20 24 ------------ ------------- ----------------- -------------

The probability that the person drawn has a CES-D score greater than 16, given that it is a woman, is equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.3
* 0.48
* 0.71
* 0.75

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.3: Incorrect
* 0.48: Correct
* 0.71: Incorrect
* 0.75: Incorrect
